summary:
Oslo is Norway's largest city and capital. It has a long history, dating back to the Viking Age. Established as a trading center in 1048, it became a bishopric in 1070 and the capital around 1300. The city was renamed Christiania in the 17th century but changed back to Oslo in 1925.

Oslo is Norway's economic and political hub, known for its shipping and maritime industries. It is considered a global city and has been ranked highly for quality of life. The population is growing rapidly due to immigration and birth rates.
title: Oslo
